author: mwrock
body: Walking through these instructions I found that `Start-PSBuild` required `vsvarsall.bat` which is only installed with Visual Studio and its optional feature Common Tools for Visual C++ so the readme should specify this and in this case (I think this is right), the other redist packages are redundant.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
As far as I remember, these instructions came from [bug in dotnet cli](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/1543) as a workaround.

We didn't build any native components for Core Edition on Windows until recently, so there is nothing specific about C++ compiler in `windows-core.md`. The relevant info exists in `windows-full.md`, because we build native host from the very beginning. @mirichmo can you, please, copy appropriate install instruction about VS C++ from `windows-full.md`?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: The [latest comment](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/1543#issuecomment-235680399) on dotnet cli issue suggests that the problem may go away. If we can validate it, we can remove redist-related instructions.

comments.author: mwrock
comments.body: As it stands now, `vcvarsall.bat` is required by `Start-PSBuild` which means one must install VS with the Common Tools for C++ feature. Would that preclude any need to install a separate C++ compiler redistributable?

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: also in #1715 this has been discussed to see if we can remove the dependency on having VS installed at all (for me that would be a big win)

comments.author: mwrock
comments.body: Yeah eliminating the need for a full vs install would be ideal.

comments.author: mwrock
comments.body: ok I made the modifications but I have to move to a new PR #1973. After I converted my private fork to public it lost its "forkness" and I had to refork.

title: Clarify that visual studio with c++ compiler is required
